page.title: 05 Cecil Day-Lewis
page.content:
{Cecil Day-Lewis}lived near Musbury Castle. Cecil, the Queens Poet Laureate and he wrote poems for her. Cecil was also an air-raid warden in the Second World War.
He would go to the top of Musbury Castle (see page 2) and look out for enemy aircraft. He would Take a large gun with him to shoot any enemies.
The cottage he lived in is a very quaint cottage. It has a thatched roof, oakwood doors and small windows. As we know, Cecil was the Poet Laureate, "Laureate" means honoured and glorious. The poet Laureate writes poems for the queens birthday and other special occasions.
Cecil died at the age of seventy.
